2410.08674.title: Guidelines for Fine-grained Sentence-level Arabic Readability Annotation
2410.08674.paper_summary:
This paper presents the foundational framework and initial findings of the
Balanced Arabic Readability Evaluation Corpus (BAREC) project, designed to
address the need for comprehensive Arabic language resources aligned with
diverse readability levels. Inspired by the Taha/Arabi21 readability reference,
BAREC aims to provide a standardized reference for assessing sentence-level
Arabic text readability across 19 distinct levels, ranging in targets from
kindergarten to postgraduate comprehension. Our ultimate goal with BAREC is to
create a comprehensive and balanced corpus that represents a wide range of
genres, topics, and regional variations through a multifaceted approach
combining manual annotation with AI-driven tools. This paper focuses on our
meticulous annotation guidelines, demonstrated through the analysis of 10,631
sentences/phrases (113,651 words). The average pairwise inter-annotator
agreement, measured by Quadratic Weighted Kappa, is 79.9%, reflecting a high
level of substantial agreement. We also report competitive results for
benchmarking automatic readability assessment. We will make the BAREC corpus
and guidelines openly accessible to support Arabic language research and
education.
2410.08674.paper_summary_zh: 本文呈現「平衡阿拉伯語可讀性評估語料庫」(BAREC) 項目的基礎架構和初步調查結果，旨在滿足與不同可讀性程度相符的綜合阿拉伯語語言資源需求。BAREC 受到 Taha/Arabi21 可讀性參考的啟發，目標是提供一個標準化參考，用於評估 19 個不同層級的句子層級阿拉伯語文本可讀性，目標範圍從幼兒園到研究所程度的理解。我們對 BAREC 的最終目標，是透過結合手動註解和 AI 驅動工具的多面向方法，建立一個涵蓋廣泛類型、主題和區域變異的全面且平衡的語料庫。本文重點介紹我們的細緻註解準則，並透過分析 10,631 個句子/片語（113,651 個字）來加以說明。由加權二次 Kappa 測量，平均成對標註者間的一致性為 79.9%，反映出高度實質一致性。我們也報告了自動可讀性評估基準測試的競爭結果。我們將開放 BAREC 語料庫和準則，以支持阿拉伯語研究和教育。
2410.08674.author: Nizar Habash et.al.
